meanings.definition: To be against or in conflict with something.
meanings.sent1: She opposed the idea of staying up late.
meanings.sent2: The two teams were opposed in the championship match.
meanings.sent3: The cat opposed taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds opposed the clear blue sky, creating a dramatic contrast.

meanings.definition: To act in opposition or resistance to something.
meanings.sent1: He opposed the new policy at work.
meanings.sent2: The protestors opposed the construction of the new highway.
meanings.sent3: The toddler opposed getting dressed by running around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her determination opposed any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind opposed the progress of the sailboat, making it difficult to move forward.
